question: Question_03_(d)
statement:
\textbf{Full-Solution Problem.} Justify your answers and \textbf{show
all your work.} Simplification of answers is not required.

Evaluate the following integral.

\begin{align*}\int \frac{dx}{\sqrt{x^2+16}}.\end{align*}
hints:
Your trigonometric substitution should make use of the fact that
$a^2+a^2\tan^2\theta = a^2\sec^2\theta.$
